alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 1:01PM EDT until July 07 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates of greater than 3 inches per hour will contribute to rapid accumulation of rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tamaqua, Hometown, Tuscarora, New Philadelphia, Grier City- Park Crest, Coaldale, Snyders, Locust Lake State Park, Cumbola, Middleport, Mary-D, Brockton and Kaska. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
